intro: Rubus nemorosus var. pilosus, commonly known as the hairy bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are aggregate berries that ripen to a dark red color in late summer. This variety is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils across temperate regions.
